intro: Draba taylorii, commonly known as Taylor's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual or biennial plant characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Native to the western United States, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to rocky and sandy soils.
